publicly adverb
(TO EVERYONE)

C1 If something is done publicly, it is done so that everyone can know about it: The company publicly apologized and agreed to contribute some money to charity. publicly humiliated
More examplesFewer examplesEmployees have publicly criticized the company's plans, much to the displeasure of the management.A publicly disunited party stands little chance of winning the election.
